content.title: Agri-Clinics And Agri-Business Centres Scheme
content.department: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
content.beneficiary: Unemployed agricultural graduates, agricultural diploma holders, intermediate in agriculture, and biological science graduates with PG in agri-related courses
content.details: A welfare scheme by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare was launched in 2002. AC&ABC aims at agricultural development by supplementing the efforts of public extension by providing extension and other services to farmers either on a payment basis or free of cost as per the business model of agri-preneur, local needs, and affordability of the target group of farmers. AC&ABC creates gainful self-employment opportunities for unemployed agricultural graduates, agricultural diploma holders, intermediate in agriculture, and biological science graduates with PG in agri-related courses. NABARD is acting as a subsidy channelizing agency for this scheme.
benefits: Expert advice and services to farmers on various aspects to enhance productivity
Support in soil health, cropping practices, plant protection, crop insurance, and post-harvest technology
Full financial support for training and handholding
Provision of loans and credit-linked back-end composite subsidy
eligibility: Age of the applicant must be between 18 and 60 years
Graduates in agriculture and allied subjects from recognized universities
Diploma holders in Agriculture and allied subjects
Biological Science Graduates with Post Graduation in Agriculture & allied subjects
Agriculture-related courses at intermediate level with at least 55% marks
exclusions: Retired Employees Getting Pensionary Benefits Are Not Eligible For Subsidy
content.application_process: Online. Visit the Official Website, fill in the mandatory fields, upload required documents, and click 'Submit' to complete the application process.

faqs.question: How much is a crop loan per acre?
faqs.answer: DBT will be given at the rate of Rs 4,000 per acre per season for cropping while zero-interest loan will be at the rate of Rs 50,000 per hectare to be capped at Rs 1 lakh per farmer.

faqs.question: What is the lock in period for bank loans?
faqs.answer: A beneficiary cannot close the bank loans within three years from the date of availing loans.

faqs.question: What is the subsidy pattern?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is 36% of the Total Financial Outlay (TFO) for General Category candidates and 44% for Women, SC/ST/NE and Hilly State Candidates.

faqs.question: Is there any other condition for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Yes, retired employees getting pensionary benefits are not eligible for subsidy.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the training?
faqs.answer: 45 days of residential training for the students who are desirous of setting up agri-clinics and agri-business centers.
